intro: Cynanchum perrieri, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed or the blue milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is known for its milky sap, which is toxic. Cynanchum perrieri is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional Chinese medicine.
